intro: Ranunculus bonariensis var. trisepalus, commonly known as the three-sepal buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It features showy, yellow flowers with three prominent sepals that resemble petals, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and early summer, often in clusters at the top of the stems. The species is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in well-drained soils.
